intro: Quesnelia enderi, commonly known as the Brazilian pine, is a species of pine native to Brazil. It is a coniferous evergreen tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features needle-like leaves and produces cones, which are characteristic of the pine family. It has a slow growth rate and can live for several decades. The botanical features of Quesnelia enderi make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
